name: wsl-screen-snipper
description: Automatically detect Windows screenshots and copy them to WSL with seamless terminal integration. Commands: 'Save Clipboard Image' (manual), 'Revert to Default Settings' (reset).

commands.title: WSL Screen Snipper: Revert to Default Settings

wslScreenSnipper.windowsUsername.markdownDescription:
**Windows Username**

Your Windows username for locating screenshots at `/mnt/c/Users/{username}/Pictures/Screenshots`

*Leave empty to use custom path below*

wslScreenSnipper.customWindowsPath.markdownDescription:
**Custom Windows Screenshots Path** *(optional)*

Full path to Windows Screenshots folder. Only used if username above is empty.

*Example:* `/mnt/c/Users/john/Documents/MyScreenshots`

wslScreenSnipper.tempFolderName.markdownDescription:
**Temp Folder Name**

Creates hidden folder `.{name}` in workspace root

*Leave empty to use custom path below*

wslScreenSnipper.customTempPath.markdownDescription:
**Custom Temp Path** *(optional)*

Full path for temp directory. Only used if folder name above is empty.

*Example:* `/tmp/screenshots`

wslScreenSnipper.autoCleanup.markdownDescription:
**Auto Cleanup**

Remove entire temp directory when VS Code closes

wslScreenSnipper.addToGitignore.markdownDescription:
**Add to .gitignore**

Add temp folder to `.gitignore` (workspace folders only)

wslScreenSnipper.pollingInterval.markdownDescription:
**Polling Interval (ms)**

How often to check for new screenshots (100-5000ms). Lower values = faster detection but more CPU usage
